intro: Phyteuma betonicifolium var. persicifolium, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Caucasus region. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can reach a height of up to 60 cm. The species is part of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their beauty and adaptability.
